summary: This is a press statement from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein in his jail cell. It confirms his death was an apparent suicide and states the investigation into his sex trafficking crimes remains ongoing, urging victims to come forward.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused sex trafficker who was found dead in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center from an apparent suicide.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who issued the statement announcing Epstein's death and reaffirming the ongoing investigation into his crimes.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Listed as a contact in the footer of the press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and pronounced dead shortly thereafter from an apparent suicide.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in his jail cell from an apparent suicide.
The U.S. Attorney's Office confirmed the death and stated the investigation into his sex trafficking of minors remains ongoing.
The statement is directed at Epstein's victims, urging them to come forward and contact the FBI.
